chapters.title: The Aspiring Archer
chapters.description: Ekalavya, a tribal boy, aspired to master archery and sought Dronacharya as his teacher.

chapters.title: The Self-Taught Pupil
chapters.description: Rejected by Dronacharya, Ekalavya built a clay idol of his guru and practiced diligently before it.

chapters.title: The Test of Skill
chapters.description: Ekalavya demonstrated his exceptional archery skills when he stopped a dog from barking without harming it.

chapters.title: The Ultimate Sacrifice
chapters.description: To honor his guru, Ekalavya willingly gave his thumb when Dronacharya asked for it as guru dakshina.
